result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner J. Ippolito was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanner J. Ippolito

records.addlTxt: 10:55 AM Defendant Tanner J. Ippolito not in court.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bench warrant ordered on defendants nonappearance. Cash bond of  $250 set. Reviewable by Court Commissioner. RECALLED 11:01 AM Defendant Tanner J. Ippolito in court LATE.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant vacated. Defendant waives his right to an attorney. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty of count 1. Count 2 dismissed and read in. Court orders $50 plus costs due within 60 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

3:08 PM Defendant Tanner J. Ippolito in court.  Attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was outside of the courtroom when case was previously called. Warrant vacated. Defendant waives right to an attorney freely and voluntarily.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:22 PM Defendant Tanner J. Ippolito not in court.  Attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant on defendant's non-appearance. Cash bond set $100. Reviewable by any Judicial Official.
JV2235324. Reviewable by any Judicial Official.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

2:40 PM  Defendant Tanner J. Ippolito appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wants to represent himself.  Defendant wants to enter a no contest plea.  Matter to be set with Judge Morse.  Bond continued.
Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tanner J. Ippolito appeared by video. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $1000 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim S.I., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Defendant to sign bond between August 16, 2022 and August 19, 2022. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 1:00pm.
